STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 20, 2024
Renee L Gonzales
BRANCH COUNTY DHHS
388 KEITH WILHELM DR,
COLDWATER, MI, 49036-8244
Re: License #: CP120200999
Dear Renee L Gonzales:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
December 19, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
question. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
(2) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster
child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in the child's
placement at least once every month.
One of Six open files of youth in foster care placement reviewed did not contain
documentation of a social service worker's face to face visit with the youth and the
youth's foster parent, in the foster home, during the first calendar month of
placement.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(e) A dental examination must be completed within 3
months before entry into foster care or an initial dental
examination must be completed not more than 90
calendar days after entry into a foster care out-of-home
placement. A child entering foster care under 1 year of
age must have an initial dental exam within 3 months of
his or her first birthday.
One of Six open files of youths in foster care placement reviewed did not contain
documentation that an initial dental exam was completed timely.
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Review CWLM BP regarding Borrowed Bed process for upload
timeframes as well as social work contact requirements.
• If another agency is completing a foster home SER, review the findings
with that agency prior to its completion to ensure it has been completed
accurately.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding the difference between policy and
rules regarding face-to-face visits with youth in their placement every calendar
month.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was no incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The one CAP submitted by the agency was submitted in response to the
10/2/2023 licensing renewal inspection report and was approved on 10/16/2023.
That CAP addressed ten violations (6 rule & 4 policy). The agency is in
compliance with that CAP as none of the violations addressed in that CAP were
repeated this inspection year.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was reviewed and discussed during the
entrance meeting. The chief administrator indicated there has been an increase in
removals recently and the staff have been creative in locating appropriate
placements for youth to avoid youths staying at the agency office. Changes in
allocations have created some staffing changes; however, the majority of the staff
have not changed.
Financial Overview
N/A
3

Staff Interviews
No concerns were reported by any of the staff. They all report being supported by
supervision and peers and feel they have the tools needed to maintain compliance
with rule requirements.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office appears to have adequate space and equipment to provide for
the delivery of foster care, foster home certification, and independent living
services. Physical CHRI and closed adoption files are stored securely within a
locked file room to prevent unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
December 20, 2024
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 20, 2024
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
4
